@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2008 Derrell Lipman License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Derrell Lipman (derrell) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Timer manipulation for handling multiple timed callbacks with the use of only a single native timer object. Use of these timers is via the methods start() and stop(). Examples: 

 var timer = qx.util.TimerManager.getInstance();




 timer.start(function(userData, timerId)
             {
               this.debug("Recurrent 5-second timer: " + timerId);
             },
             5000,
             this,
             null,
             3000);

 timer.start(function(userData, timerId)
             {
               this.debug("One-shot 1-second timer: " + timerId);
             },
             0,
             this,
             null,
             1000);


 timer.start(function(userData, timerId)
             {
               this.debug("Recurrent 2-second timer with limit 3:" +
                          timerId);
               if (++userData.count == 3)
               {
                 this.debug("Stopping recurrent 2-second timer");
                 timer.stop(timerId);
               }
             },
             2000,
             this,
             { count : 0 });

 timer.start(function(userData, timerId)
             {
               this.debug("Immediate one-shot timer: " + timerId);
             });

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Next timer id value is determined by incrementing this

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether we're currently listening on the interval timer event

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
callback {Function}
   Function to be called upon expiration of the timer.  The function is
   passed these parameters:
   <dl>
     <dt>userData</dt>
       <dd>The user data provided to the start() method</dd>
     <dt>timerId</dt>
       <dd>The timer id, as was returned by the start() method</dd>
   </dl>
@param.description:
Function to be called upon expiration of the timer.  The function is
   passed these parameters:
   <dl>
     <dt>userData</dt>
       <dd>The user data provided to the start() method</dd>
     <dt>timerId</dt>
       <dd>The timer id, as was returned by the start() method</dd>
   </dl>

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
recurTime {Integer|null}
   If null, the timer will not recur.  Once the callback function
   returns the first time, the timer will be removed from the timer
   queue.  If non-null, upon return from the callback function, the
   timer will be reset to this number of milliseconds.
@param.description:
If null, the timer will not recur.  Once the callback function
   returns the first time, the timer will be removed from the timer
   queue.  If non-null, upon return from the callback function, the
   timer will be reset to this number of milliseconds.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
Context (this) the callback function is called with.  If not
   provided, this Timer singleton object is used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
userData {var}
   Data which is passed to the callback function upon timer expiry
@param.description: Data which is passed to the callback function upon timer expiry

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
initialTime {Integer|null}
   Milliseconds before the callback function is called the very first
   time.  If not specified and recurTime is specified, then recurTime
   will be used as initialTime; otherwise initialTime will default
   to zero.
@param.description:
Milliseconds before the callback function is called the very first
   time.  If not specified and recurTime is specified, then recurTime
   will be used as initialTime; otherwise initialTime will default
   to zero.

@return.name: @return
@return.description:
The timer id of this unique timer.  It may be provided to the stop()
   method to cancel a timer before expiration.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
timerId {Integer}
   A timer id previously returned by start()
@param.description: A timer id previously returned by start()

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Insert a timer on the time-ordered list of active timers.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
expireAt {Integer}
   Milliseconds from now when this timer should expire
@param.description: Milliseconds from now when this timer should expire

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
timerId {Integer}
   Id of the timer to be time-ordered
@param.description: Id of the timer to be time-ordered

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Process the queue of timers. Call the registered callback function for any timer which has expired. If the timer is marked as recurrent, the timer is restarted with the recurrent timeout following completion of the callback function.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
